head.title: Kyoto Treaty: The Future Is Now

hedline.hl1: Kyoto Treaty: The Future Is Now

abstract.p: John M Wilson letter on Dec 4 editorial notes Pres Bush's negativism toward Kyoto treaty to curb global warming is shared by Senate and many Americans

block.p: Although you criticize the Bush administration's envoy for her argument opposing the Kyoto Protocol, your critique also misses two important points (editorial, Dec. 4).
Although you criticize the Bush administration's envoy for her argument opposing the Kyoto Protocol, your critique also misses two important points (editorial, Dec. 4).

In 1997, the Senate made clear its opposition to Kyoto, unanimously adopting a resolution rejecting any agreement that would cause harm to the United States economy. The treaty was never approved by the Senate, although it had been signed by the Clinton administration in 1998.
In addition, Kyoto leaves large ''developing'' countries, like China, out of the mix. This will cause competitive injury to our economy.
So, please: you want to blame President Bush, but his ''negativism'' toward this treaty is shared by the Senate and by many Americans.
